recommendations.recommendation: Probably the strongest start outside of 5D`s. Mostly "monster of the week"-type plotlines early on lends itself to wasted time, but there are strong characters that start getting developed roughly 10 episodes in. Best animation of anything in the franchise up to this point.

anime.description: The story takes place in the near future in a city called Heartland. http://anidb.net/ch28990 [Tsukumo Yuuma] is a young duelist who strives to become the Duel Monsters champion, despite being an amateur. One day, during a duel with a school bully, a mysterious spirit called http://anidb.net/ch28991 [Astral] appears before Yuuma, and helps him to win. Astral then explains to Yuuma that he is searching for his lost memories, which have been transformed into 99 "Xyz Monster" cards called "Numbers" and have been scattered across the globe. The "Numbers" have the ability to possess the duelists who own them and bring out their darkest desires. In order to recover his memories, and collect the "Numbers" cards, Astral teams up with Yuuma.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: summoning
tag.description: Ability to call/materialize some kind of creature.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: amnesia
tag.description: The character suffers from some kind of amnesia (memory disturbance or loss). This may mean inability to memorize new information, or inability to recollect old memories. Since there are many types of memory, the person may e.g. forget who they are but still retain learned skills. Amnesia is fairly common in fiction as a plot device. In fact, because it allows for major plot changes while requiring little creativity from the author, it may be subject to heavy overuse.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: merchandising show
tag.description: The bane of the parent`s wallet; this show usually has only a single reason for existence: to advertise the toy line it is based upon to the intended target audience. The variety of toys can range from accessories for girls and boys, to cards and figures or models. Most often the ability of the toys will be exaggerated or invokes magic to work in the anime. The toys`s names will also be continuously repeated in the anime, often accompanied by flashy effects and loud shouting. Combined with an intricate story that typically involves an adventure or a tournament of sorts, it makes for an effective commercial.

tag.name: it`s time to duel
tag.description: Individual characters frequently face each other head-on, usually for a prize.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: zero to hero
tag.description: With his first appearance, this character is getting his ass kicked by nearly everyone, but as the plot continues, through training (mental or physical) or instant power-up, he changes into a killing/fighting/winning machine. The best example: Makunouchi Ippo from Hajime no Ippo series.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: Engrish
tag.description: Engrish is actually a mispronunciation of English, as can be the result of someone, who does not have English as their primary language of origin (such as Japanese or Chinese). Occasionally characters in the original Japanese dialogue version of an anime will speak in English... however; this often still requires the assistance of subtitles, for while the words are meant to be said in English, the sentence structure and letter pronunciation may still be strongly related to the person’s primary language.

tag.name: serious business
tag.description: For some people it is just a card- or board game. For others it is not just a matter of life and death — it is much more important than that. Serious business basically describes a situation, when a show revolves around an activity where a sizeable portion of the in-series population takes it far more seriously than it should. If something`s popularity rivals that of Elvis, or if there are mainstream schools devoted to it instead of teaching reading, writing, and arithmetic; it is serious business.

tag.name: gotta catch them all
tag.description: A typical plot or sub-plot for many shows. Either the cast or somebody else, that being often the main antagonist, embarks on a quest to collect things, shiny things. Things that are said to grant simple wishes or even do miracles like bringing people back to life, destroying the whole world, galaxy, universe and in rare cases turning the hero into the greatest Pokemon Master. Those things can be weapons, lost technology, magical artefacts, pieces of a giant magical artefact and in some cases even people or little critters. The point is, there`s stuff to collect!

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tenjou Kaito
character.description: Tenjou Kaito is a Number Hunter who is gathering Numbers with the help of a robot named Orbital 7.

character.name: Quattro
character.description: Quattro, known as IV in the Japanese version, Four in the Italian version, and born Thomas Arclight, is a Number Hunter and the Champion of Asia.

episode.title: かっとビングだぜ, オレ!!
Bring it to `Em!!
Yuma startet durch - Teil 1
Katto Bingu Da ze, Ore!!
episode.summary: It’s sink or swim for Yuma when he puts his deck on the line and challenges Shark, the school bully, to a duel. Can Yuma beat the school’s #1 duelist, or will Yuma’s life points get reeled in by this ruthless opponent? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: わが名はアストラル
My Name is Astral
Yuma startet durch - Teil 2
Waga Na wa Astral
episode.summary: It’s a dueling disaster for Yuma when a mysterious visitor from another galaxy suddenly appears, putting his duel with Shark in serious jeopardy! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デュエルのウラを読むウラ!
The Other Side Where the Other Side of the Duel is Read!
Flip oder Flop! - Teil 1
Duel no Ura o Yomu Ura!
episode.summary: When fellow classmate Flip offers Yuma an Xyz Monster, Tori and Bronk literally flip out and warn Yuma to stay clear of this two-faced trouble maker - a task that turns out to be easier said than done! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆転のカウントダウン! 秘策はアストラル!?
The Turnaround Countdown! The Counter Strategy Lies with Astral!?
Der Computervirus - Teil 2
Gyakuten no Countdown! Hisaku wa Astral!?
episode.summary: Yuma must figure out a way to outduel his math teacher Mr. Kay before his life points are completely subtracted and the virus planted in the city’s computer system goes… viral! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トドのつまり事件です!!
The Events After The Fact!!
Der Computervirus - Teil 1
Todo no Tsumari Jiken Desu!!
episode.summary: When the city is thrust into chaos after several of its computers become infected by a malicious virus, Yuma and Tori set out to find the culprit! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キャットオドロく猫デッキ!?
Cat`s Surprise: Cat Deck!?
Duell mit Cathy
Cat Odoroku Neko Deck!?
episode.summary: In order to find his missing friend Tori, Yuma must face off against a feline fanatic who has the purr-fect answers to his every move! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スター・ロビンよ永遠に
Star Robin is Forever
Yuma kämpft für Nelson - Teil 2
Star Robin yo Eien ni
episode.summary: Yuma must figure out a way to defeat The Sparrow and his powerful Galaxy Queen before Nelson and Astral disappear forever! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正義の大盤振る舞い! エスパー・ロビン参上!!
The Grand Feast of Justice! Esper Robin Arrives!!
Yuma kämpft für Nelson - Teil 1
Seigi no Oubanfurumai! Esper Robin Sanjou!!
episode.summary: When Nelson Andrews, star of the hit TV series “The Sparrow,“ becomes possessed by a Number Card, Yuma challenges him to a duel, putting Astral’s safety on the line! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裏切りのナンバーズ!?
The Treacherous Numbers!?
Flip oder Flop! - Teil 2
Uragiri no Numbers!?
episode.summary: Yuma must figure out a way to defeat Flip or risk losing his Utopia card… and Astral forever! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魂を狩る者! ナンバーズ・ハンター現る!
Soul Hunt! Rise of the Numbers Hunters!
Jagd auf Nummern - Teil 1
Tamashi o Karusha! Numbers Hunter Arawaru!
episode.summary: Yuma and Astral face their toughest battle ever when they are forced to duel a mysterious individual who hunts Number Cards! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望の合体! アーマード・エクシーズ発動!
Hope`s Fusion! Armored Xyz Activate!
Das Rudel - Teil 2
Kibou no Gattai! Armored Xyz Hatsudou!
episode.summary: Yuma and Shark’s tag team battle against The Pack reaches a fevery pitch, for if Yuma loses, he also loses Utopia! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遊馬(ゆうま)とシャーク 傷だらけのタッグデュエル
Yuma and Shark`s Tag Duel
Das Rudel - Teil 1
Yuuma to Shark, Kizu Darake no Tag Duel
episode.summary: When Yuma learns that Shark is going to be set up to take the fall for stealing a priceless deck, Yuma challenges Shark’s thug friends to a duel! Can Yuma put a stop to The Pack’s thieving plan and save Shark’s skin, or will these thugs prove too powerful for Yuma and his deck? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆襲のシャーク!
Shark`s Counterattack!
Shark greift an
Gyakushuu no Shark!
episode.summary: Yuma discovers that Shark has started running with the wrong crowd and given up dueling! Can Yuma hook Shark back into battling, or are Shark`s dueling days done forever? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カオスエクシーズ・チェンジ! 希望の光ホープ・レイ!!
Chaos XYZ Change! Light of Hope: Hope Ray!!
Der Wahrsager - Teil 2
Chaos XYZ Change! Kibou no Hikari Hope Ray!!
episode.summary: Yuma must figure out a way to defeat the mysterious and all-knowing Fortuno if he wants to save his friends, his Number Card and his soul! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: すべてを見通す者 恐怖の占い師・ジン
The Psychic Who Predicts all Fear!
Der Wahrsager - Teil 1
Subete o Mitoosusha Kyoufu no Uranaishi Jin
episode.summary: When a mysterious fortune teller agrees to help out Yuma’s friends, they soon find themselves in a terrifying situation that no one ever saw coming! Can Yuma rescue his pals, or will the all-knowing Fortuno see to it that Yuma doesn’t succeed? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 必殺忍法! 最恐忍者あらわる!
Finishing Ninja Art! The Most Feared Ninja Appears!
Das Duell-Kloster -Teil 2
Hissatsu Ninpou! Saikowa Ninja Arawaru!
episode.summary: After challenging Master Roku’s former student to a duel, Yuma relies on his master’s teachings in order to defeat the evil Kaze and save the Duel Sanctuary’s Legendary Deck! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死闘, 決闘庵(デュエルあん) 伝説のモンスター復活!!
Battle to the Death, Duel Lodge, Legendary Monsters Revived!!
Das Duell-Kloster -Teil 1
Shitou, Duelan, Densetsu no Monsters Fukkatsu!!
episode.summary: The legendary Dark Magician and Blue-Eyes White Dragon come out of retirement when a wise old man named Master Roku challenges Yuma to duel! Can Yuma’s Dark Magician pull a victory out of thin air, or will the power of Master Roku’s three Blue-Eyes be too much for Yuma to handle? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 『銀河眼の光子竜(ギャラクシーアイズ・フォトン・ドラゴン)』降臨!
Galaxy Eyes Photon Dragon` Descends!
Jagd auf Nummern - Teil 2
"Galaxy Eyes Photon Dragon" Kourin!
episode.summary: As the back-and-forth battle between Yuma and the mysterious Number Hunter continues, Yuma must duel like he’s never dueled before if he wants to save Astral, his Number Cards and his soul! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奪われた皇の鍵! 激突カイトvsシャーク
Emperor`s Key Stolen! Kaito vs Shark
Kite kehrt zurück
Ubawareta Sumeragi no Kagi! Gekitotsu Kaito vs Shark
episode.summary: Shark tries to stop Kite from stealing Yuma’s Golden Key by challenging him to a duel! Can Shark sink his teeth into Kite’s life points and save Yuma’s prized possession, or will Kite’s cunning skills sink any chance Shark has of winning? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遊馬vsお掃除ロボット オボミ
Yuma vs The Cleaning Robot Obomi
Lilly, das Roboter-Mädchen
Asuma vs Osouji Robot Obomi
episode.summary: Yuma befriends a broken Litterbot only to discover that it has been programmed to do the dirty work for a wanted jewel thief. Can Yuma put a stop to this thief’s thieving ways, or will Yuma’s newest friend trash his plan to stop him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 漆黒のナンバーズ 闇遊馬vs鉄男
The Pitch-Black Numbers: Dark Yuma vs Tetsuo
Freund gegen Freund
Shikkoku no Numbers Yami Yuma vs Tetsuo
episode.summary: When Yuma gets into a fight with Bronk, their friendship is soon put to the ultimate test when an evil Number Card takes control of Yuma! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束のかっとビング
The Promised Kattobing
Der goldene Schlüssel
Yakusoku no Kattobing
episode.summary: While on the way to School Spirit Day, Yuma realizes the Golden Key his father gave him is missing. As Astral and Yuma retrace his steps, Yuma shares the exciting story behind the Golden Key’s origins! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宿命の決闘(デュエル)! アストラルvsカイト
The Fated Duel! Astral vs Kaito
Vom Jäger zum gejagten - Teil 1
Shukumei no Duel! Astral vs Kaito
episode.summary: With his Golden Key in Kite’s possession, Yuma must hunt down the Number Hunter if he ever wants to see Astral again! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 時の訪れ 現われし3つの太陽
The Time Has Come, The Three Suns Appear
Wenn die Zeit still steht ...
Toki no Otozure, Arawareshi 3-tsu no Taiyou
episode.summary: When an unexpected phenomenon stops time, Kite is able to gain the upper hand by tapping into Astral`s memories and witnessing firsthand the battles that he and Yuma have fought together. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魂のエクシーズ召喚! ZEXAL
The Soul`s Xyz Summon! Zexal
Vom Jäger zum gejagten - Teil 2
Tamashii no Xyz Shoukan! ZEXAL
episode.summary: While Yuma continues to search for Astral and the Golden Key, Astral continues to search for a way to defeat Kite and save all his Number Cards! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遊馬最大の試練! 死闘, 野菜デスマッチ
Yuma`s Greatest Ordeal! Fight to Death, Vegetable Death Match
Tomaten-Trauma
Yuuma Saidai no Shiren! Shitou, Yasai Death Match
episode.summary: Yuma faces his toughest test to date when he challenges the tomato loving Tombo to a duel! Can Yuma overcome his hate for tomatoes and be victorious, or will his taste buds only be serving up defeat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鉄道デッキ発進! 暴走決闘者(デュエリスト)アンナ
Railroad Deck Takeoff! Runaway Duelist Anna
Eine Herzensangelegenheit
Tetsudou Deck Hasshin! Bousou Duelist Anna
episode.summary: Love hurts and Yuma’s about to find out why! Yuma broke Anna’s heart years ago, and now she’s back for revenge! If Yuma loses, he has to be Anna’s boyfriend… forever! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 工事現場デュエル! 重機デッキを打ち破れ!!
Construction Site Duel! Destroy the Digger Deck!!
Kleine und große Taten
Koujigenba Duel! Juuki Deck o Uchiyabure!!
episode.summary: Hoping to keep the momentum going in the wake of his latest victory, Yuma rises up to the challenge of a pint-sized duelist and his deck of monster machines! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: WDCキックオフ! 炎のストライカー・国立(くにたち)カケル
WDC Kicks Off! The Burning Striker - Kakeru Kunitachi
Teamarbeit
World Duel Carnival Kick Off! Honoo no Striker Kunitachi Kakeru
episode.summary: The World Duel Carnival kicks off when Yuma is challenged by Striker, a soccer player turned duelist who has one goal in mind – scoring a victory! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開幕! WDC(ワールド・デュエル・カーニバル)
Begin! World Duel Carnival!
Mögen die Duelle beginnen!
Kaimaku! World Duel Carnival
episode.summary: With the World Duel Carnival about to begin, Yuma gets set to take on the best duelists from around the world… that is, until he realizes he never entered! Can Yuma figure out a way to join the Carnival, or will Yuma’s efforts fall short, forcing him to watch from the sidelines? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: その名はチャーリー! 史上最強の運を持つ男
His name is Charlie, the Man with the Strongest Luck in History
Das Leben ist ein Karneval - Teil 1
Sono Na wa Charly! Saikyo no Un o Motsu Otoko
episode.summary: Yuma gets taken for a wild ride when Kari`s friend steals an extremely lucky card from the local museum! Relying on pure skill, Yuma must figure out a way to beat the luckiest guy in the world! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無敵の強運! No.7ラッキー・ストライプ
Invincible Luck! Number 7: Lucky Stripe
Das Leben ist ein Karneval - Teil 2
Muteki no Kyouin! No. 7 Lucky Stripe
episode.summary: Yuma’s duel atop an out-of-control monorail takes a turn for the worse when his opponent plays a Number Card that guarantees a win every time! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地獄のタッグデュエル! 悪魔のヒーローIV
Tag Duel of Hell! Fiendish Hero IV
Fantastische Fans
Jigoku no Tag Due!l! Akuma no Hero IV
episode.summary: It’s a dream come true for Caswell and Bronk when their favorite duelist in the world challenges them to a duel! Unfortunately for these two fans, that dream is about to become a nightmare! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決意の復讐 哀しき決闘者(デュエリスト)シャーク
The Detemined Revenge, Tragic Duelist, Shark
Das Unterwasser-Duell
Ketsui no Fukushuu: Kanashiki Duelist Shark
episode.summary: Out for revenge, Shark looks to sink his teeth into a duel with Quattro, but he instead gets hooked into an underwater battle with Quattro’s sinister sibling! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 衝撃のスクープ! 小鳥の危険な未来
The Shocking Scoop, Kotori`s Dangerous Future!
Zukunftsbilder - Teil 1
Shougeki no Scoop! Kotori no Kiken na Mirai
episode.summary: Yuma hunts down a photographer whose pictures can predict the future! Unfortunately for Yuma and his friend Tori, it’s a future that’s not so bright! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未来を切り開く力! 希望皇ホープレイ
The Power to Create the Future! Aspiring Emperor Hope Ray
Zukunftsbilder - Teil 2
Mirai o Kiri Hiraku Chikara! Kibou Hope Ray
episode.summary: Tori’s future is literally up in the air when the damaged airship she is on takes a turn for the worse - just as Yuma’s opponent Cameron predicted! Can Yuma save his best friend by winning his duel, or are the future photos Cameron snapped set in stone?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: WDC(ワールド・デュエル・カーニバル)失格!? ハートランドの刺客ドロワ&ゴーシュ
Disqualified from the WDC!? Heartland`s Assassins, Droite and Gauche
Zwei gegen einen - Teil 1
World Duel Carnival Shikkaku!? Heartland no Shikyaku Droite & Gauche
episode.summary: After accidentally falling asleep, Flip wakes up to a nightmare realization – he just slept through the first day of the World Duel Carnival! Realizing only the strongest duelists are left, Flip comes up with a sweet plan to get some much-needed Heart Pieces! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望をつなげ! ホープ剣マーズ・スラッシュ!!
Bound to Hope! Hope Sword Mars Slash!!
Zwei gegen einen - Teil 2
Kibou o Tsunage! Hope Ken Mars Slash!!
episode.summary: With Astral missing, Yuma must rely on his skills alone if he wants to defeat Nistro and Dextra and save his deck and spot in the World Duel Carnival! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えたハルト! 新たなる敵トロン
Haruto Is Gone! The New Enemy: Tron
Hart wird entführt
Kieta Haruto! Aratanaru Teki Tron
episode.summary: As Kite desperately searches for his brother Hart, Vetrix puts his diabolical plan for revenge in motion! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハートランドからの来訪者ハルト
Visitor from Heartland: Haruto
Harts Mission
Heartland kara no Raihousha Haruto
episode.summary: After using his powers to escape from Heartland City, Hart unleashes a path of destruction that only Yuma can help stop! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宿命の対決! キャットちゃんVSドッグちゃん
The Destined Showdown! Cat vs Dog
Hund oder Katze?
Shukumei no Taiketsu! Cat-chan vs Dog-chan
episode.summary: When Yuma`s Heart Pieces are swiped by a pack of stray dogs, Cathy calls on her feline friends to help hunt them down! After finding the hounds` hideout, Cathy is challenged by the pack leader to a duel! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遊馬とカイト 魂のタッグ・デュエル
Yuma & Kaito: A Spirited Tag Duel
Ein Dubioses Duo
Yuuma to Kaito Tamashii no Tag Duel
episode.summary: While Kite and Yuma square off in a tag team battle against Trey and Quattro, Vetrix continues his quest to drain Hart of all his powers! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡のオーバーレイ! 超銀河眼の光子龍(ネオ・ギャラクシーアイズ・フォトン・ドラゴン)
The Miraculous Overlay! Neo Galaxy-Eyes Photon Dragon
Brüderliche Kraft
Kiseki no Overlay! Neo Galaxy-Eyes Photon Dragon
episode.summary: Kite must learn to work with Yuma if he wants to take down Trey and Quattro and rescue Hart! Can Kite put his pride to the side and accept Yuma’s help, or will Kite’s ego end up sacrificing Hart’s safety?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の分かれ道! デュエルを捨てた遊馬!
The Forked Paths of Destiny! Yuma Throws Away Dueling!
Harte Entscheidungen
Unmei no Wakaremichi! Duel o Suteta Yuuma!
episode.summary: Faced with tough decisions, Yuma decides to run away from his problems and search for his father until Master Roku confronts him and forces him to face a few hard truths! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遅れてきた強敵! ロビンVSゴーシュ
A Nemesis Shows Up Late! Robin VS Gauche
Gerupfte Federn
Okuretekita Kyouteki! Robin vs Gauche
episode.summary: The race for entry into the World Duel Carnival sees Nistro clash with TV superhero The Sparrow. The feathers fly as the fierce duel hits a fever pitch! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激闘の果て!ホープレイVSアトランタル
The End of a Fierce Fight! Hope Ray VS Atlanthal
Letzte Prophezeiung
Gekitou no Hate! Hope Ray vs Atlanthal
episode.summary: The back-and-forth battle between Trey and Yuma reaches its climactic conclusion! Can Yuma defeat Trey without Astral’s assistance, or will Trey triumph, leaving Yuma one Heart Piece short of making it to the finals?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アストラル,死す...!?
Astral, Dead...!?
Bleibende Erinnerungen
Astral, Shisu...!?
episode.summary: With the bond between Astral and Yuma broken, Trey takes aim at the rest of Yuma’s life points! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遊馬が棄権!? 奪われた「かっとビング!」
Yuma`s Denied!? The Stolen "Kattobing"!
Alles oder nichts
Yuuma ga Kiken!? Ubawareta "Kattobing"!
episode.summary: After accepting Trey’s challenge to a duel, Yuma soon learns that Trey has acquired a dark and dangerous new power! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 家族のために...優しき復讐者·III[スリー]!!
For the Sake of Family... The Gentle Avenger: III!!
Familiensache
Kazoku no Tame ni... Yasashiki Fukushuusha Three!!
episode.summary: Trey makes an unexpected visit to Yuma’s house and discovers the secret behind Yuma’s incredible dueling skills - over lunch! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命のレール 罠カードで運試し!?
The Fated Rail: Try Your Luck On A Trap Card!?
Kopf oder Zahl
Unmei no Rail: Wana Card de Undameshi!?
episode.summary: The World Duel Carnival takes a dark turn as the finalists descend into the Dragon’s Den – a dark and dangerous duel track that will bring defeat for many a duelist! Can Yuma make his way through the treacherous track, or will the Dragon’s Den deliver a knockout blow?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デュエル・コースターVS爆走列車!!
The Duel Coaster VS The Roaring Express
Die Triade des Terrors
Duel Coaster vs Bakusou Ressha!!
episode.summary: To assess Yuma’s dueling skills, Vetrix hires the Triad of Terror, a trio of cunning card sharks, to triple team him! Yuma better figure out a way to roll through this threesome before his dueling goes off the rails! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 行くぜ決勝大会! デュエル・コースターでGO!
Head to the Finals! The Duel Coaster is ready to GO!
Achterbahn-Duelle
Ikuza Kesshou Taikai! Duel Coaster de Go!
episode.summary: It’s time for the World Duel Carnival Finals! But prepare for a world of twists and turns because the finalists will be dueling on a roller coaster! Can Yuma handle the ups and downs of the competition, or will he be sent for a loop?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 波乱の前夜祭! 姿を現わした悪魔の決闘者[デュエリスト]·トロン
The Eve of the Storm! The Diabolical Duelist Tron Appears
Die Show beginnt
Haran no Zen`yasai! Sugata o Arawashita Akuma no Duelist Tron
episode.summary: Yuma and his friends get all decked out for the event of the year - the World Duel Carnival Finals party! But when Yuma forgets his invite, can he find a way into the festivities, or will he be forced to hit the road and head home early?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トロンVSドロワ 死蝶の誘い! 命懸けの密林フィールド
Tron VS Droite: The Deadly Butterfly`s Invitation! A Life-or-Death Jungle Field
Vergiss mein nicht!
Tron vs Droite: Shichou no Sasoi! Inochigake no Mitsurin Field
episode.summary: The heat`s on when Vetrix and Dextra duel in the jungle to decide who moves on to the World Duel Carnival semifinals! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギャラクシー・アイズ封印!? 宇宙級ナンバーズあらわる!
Galaxy-Eyes Sealed!? A Cosmic Level Numbers
Die Inschrift
Galaxy-Eyes Fuuin!? Uchuukyuu Numbers Arawaru!
episode.summary: Quinton takes a timeout during his duel against Kite to reveal the long hidden mystery about Yuma’s father’s disappearance! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙大決戦! ネオ・ギャラクシーアイズの逆襲
The Great Decisive Battle of Outer Space! Neo Galaxy-Eyes` Counterattack
Flaschenpost
Uchuu Daikessen! Neo Galaxy-Eyes no Gyakushuu
episode.summary: Quinton and Kite’s confrontation in the cosmos comes to a climactic conclusion! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シャーク撃沈! 悪夢のファンサービス
Shark Torpedoed! The Nightmarish Fan-service
Blanke Wut
Shark Gekichin! Akumu no Fan Service
episode.summary: Shark finally faces off with his archenemy, Quattro! Will Shark get his long awaited revenge, or will he end up sleeping with the fishes?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シャーク覚醒! 新たなるカオス・ナンバーズあらわる
Shark Reawakens! A New Chaos Number Appears
Rage und Rache
Shark Kakusei! Aratanaru Chaos Numbers Arawaru
episode.summary: It’s the cataclysmic conclusion between Shark and Quattro! If Shark doesn’t make a comeback from the depths of defeat, not only is he out of the tournament, but his quest for justice will go unserved! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激戦! 遊馬VSゴーシュ これがオレのデュエル魂
A Fierce Fight! Yuma VS Gauche: This is my Dueling Soul
Duell bei Sonnenuntergang
Gekisen! Yuuma vs Gauche: Kore ga Ore no Duel-damashii
episode.summary: There’s chaos in the canyon when Yuma duels Nistro to see who will get the last spot in the World Duel Carnival semifinals! Can Yuma dodge defeat in the desert, or is Nistro destined to rock Yuma`s world? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦への序章 新たなる敵Dr.フェイカー
Prelude to the Ultimate Decisive Battle: A New Enemy, Dr. Faker
Duell-Deck-Diebstahl
Kessen e no Joshou: Aratanaru Teki Dr. Faker
episode.summary: When Yuma’s deck goes missing, he and the gang set out to look for it! But when their search leads them to Heartland City, they end up finding much more than they bargained for! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐るべき闇の策略!暴かれたトロンの正体!?
The Scheme of a Horrifying Darkness! Tron`s True Form Is Revealed!?
Vertrix fiese Tricks
Osorubeki Yami no Sakuryaku! Abakareta Tron no Shoutai!?
episode.summary: The mighty masked duelist Vetrix faces off against the Number Hunter Kite! Unfortunately for Kite, Vetrix springs a shocking surprise that makes dueling all but impossible! Can Kite rise above Vetrix’s heinous handicap, or has this undefeated duelist finally met his match? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蘇れシャーク! 絆に懸けた「かっとビング!」
Shark`s Back! The Bonds Connected by "Kattobing!"
Die Rettung des Retters
Yomigaere Shark! Kizuna ni Kaketa "Kattobing!"
episode.summary: This is it! Yuma’s jaw-dropping duel against Shark in the World Duel Carnival semifinals draws to a finish! Can Yuma rise above his razor-sharp rival, or will he be dragged down to the depths of defeat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えかけた絆! 遊馬VSシャーク, 宿命の決闘[デュエル]!!
The Disappearing Bonds! Yuma VS Shark, the Fated Duel!!
Der blinde Haifisch
Kiekaketa Kizuna! Yuuma VS Shark, Shukumei no Duel!!
episode.summary: Yuma sets his sights on reeling in Shark in the first battle of the semifinals, but when his foe starts off dueling like a guppy, Yuma questions if he’s being baited! Does Yuma learn this far too late to escape a sinister Shark attack? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦慄のデュエル!立ち上がれ絆の英雄ゼアル
The Terrifying Duel! Arise, Hero of Bonds, ZEXAL!
Finale, Finale! - Teil 2
Senritsu no Duel! Tachiagare Kizuna no Eye Zexal
episode.summary: As the duel between Vetrix and Yuma races to its cataclysmic conclusion, Yuma stares down defeat and comes face-to-face with Vetrix’s shocking secret! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナンバーズ総力戦!遊馬VSトロン驚異の超異空間デュエル!
An All-Out War Between Numbers! Yuma vs Tron! The Surprising Duel in a Super-Strange Space
Finale! - Teil 1
Numbers Souryokusen! Yuuma vs Tron Kyoui Chooikuukan Duel!
episode.summary: It all comes down to this! Yuma squares off against Vetrix in a battle that will determine the first ever World Duel Carnival Champion! Can Yuma figure out a way to outduel Vetrix, or will Vetrix and his devastating deck destroy Yuma’s chance of being a champion?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネオ・ギャラクシーアイズ咆哮!闇を打ち砕く兄弟の絆!
Roar, Neo Galaxy Eyes! The Brothers` Bond that Shatters the Darkness
Ein hoher Preis
Neo Galaxy Eyes Houkou! Yami o Kuzaku Kyoudai no Kizuna!
episode.summary: The explosive end to the battle between Kite and Vetrix roars to a finish! As the battle climaxes, Yuma sets out to free Kite’s brother Hart from Vetrix’s grasp, while Kite duels knowing full well that Hart’s safety hangs in the balance! Can either of them rise above the risks, or are they both fated to fail? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦慄の最凶龍現る!偽骸神龍ハートアース・ドラゴン
The Most Evil, Horrifying Dragon Appears! The False Skeletal God Dragon, Heart-eartH Dragon
Drei gegen Faker - Teil 2
Senritsu no Saikyouryuu Arawaru! Gigaishinryuu Heartearth Dragon
episode.summary: With the fate of Astral World hanging in the balance, Yuma, Kite and Shark set their sights on stopping Dr. Faker, but before our three heroes can make their final move, Dr. Faker reveals the shocking reason behind his diabolical plan! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 集いし三勇士, 未来を賭けたラストデュエル!
The Three Heroes Unite, One Last Duel For The Future!
Drei gegen Faker - Teil 1
Tsudoishi San Yuushi, Mirai o Kaketa Last Duel!
episode.summary: Kite, Shark and Yuma join forces to take down Dr. Faker! Can this trio work together as a team and put an end to Faker’s fury, or will Faker and his deck prove to be too much of a challenge for these three fearless friends? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 崩壊への序曲 スフィア・フィールド砲の脅威!
Prelude to Ruin: The Threat of the Sphere Field Cannon!
Der Countdown beginnt
Houkai e no Jokyoku: Sphere Field Hou no Kyoui!
episode.summary: Yuma learns the details of Dr. Faker’s diabolical plan to destroy Astral World! Can Yuma figure out a way to stop Faker, or is the future of Astral World a thing of the past? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利を信じて!ファイナル・シャイニング・ドロー!
Believe in Victory! The Final Shining Draw!
Finale, Finale! - Teil 3
Shouri o Shinjite! Final Shining Draw!
episode.summary: This is it! The earth-shattering ending of Yuma’s duel against Vetrix! Can Yuma rise above Vetrix’s unrelenting onslaught, or will he meet defeat and lose everything he holds dear – his soul, his Numbers and… Astral? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻の大激突!!ダブル希望皇VSダブル銀河眼!!
The Illusive Great Clash!! Double Hope vs. Double Galaxy-Eyes!!
Kites Zweifel - Teil 2
Maboroshi no Daigekitou!! Double Hope vs Double Galaxy-Eyes!!
episode.summary: The back and forth battle between Kite and Yuma comes to an exciting conclusion that leaves one of our duelists down for the count! Will Yuma’s dream of pulling out a victory become a reality, or is Kite going to turn this dream into a nightmare? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全てを賭けて! 遊馬vsカイト!!
The Time For The Showdown!! Yuma VS Kaito, The Other Finals of the World Duel Carnival
Kites Zweifel - Teil 1
Subete o Kakete! Yuuma VS Kaito!!
episode.summary: The stage is set for the ultimate battle between Yuma and Kite, but just when Yuma’s about to high five the sky, Kite brings him crashing down to earth with a startling revelation! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡のかっとビング! 未来を切り開けゼアル!!
The Miraculous Kattobing! ZEXAL, Open The Path to the Future!!
Drei gegen Faker - Teil 3
Kiseki no Kattobing! Mirai o Kirihirake Zexal!!
episode.summary: When a mysterious being from Barian World appears, Yuma, Kite and Shark must work together and battle like never before if they want to save Hart, Astral World… and themselves! Source: crunchyroll

Opening 2
